title: Meta joins porn sites in backing new tool to fight revenge porn
description: Meta is funding debut a new tool using AI to help young people remove sexual images of themselves posted without consent.

title: Chinese state media calls out Elon Musk over coronavirus tweet
description: The Global Times called out Tesla CEO Elon Musk for responding to reports about the origination of the coronavirus.

title: ‘Don’t buy eggs. Buy TVs.’ Electronics prices are defying inflation.
description: Prices are (mostly) falling for phones, laptops and TV. Here's how you can hunt for a good deal.

title: Canada is latest country to ban TikTok on government phones
description: Canada's government said it had reviewed the Chinese-owned video-sharing app and “determined that it presents an unacceptable level of risk to privacy and security.”

title: Windows 11 update brings Bing’s chatbot to the desktop
description: Thanks to a new update, Microsoft's fascinating Bing chatbot may soon find a home on your Windows desktop. But you may find some other new features handy first.

title: See how this ‘cruelty-free’ circus replaced animals with holograms
description: The Circus-Theater Roncalli uses 3D holograms instead of real animals. The cruelty-free circus was the first of its kind.

title: Governments shut down the internet more often than ever, report says
description: Authorities in 35 countries instituted internet shutdowns at least 187 times in 2022, according to rights group Access Now, with India doing so the most.
